commit_message:
Don't use test gnocchi its not stable

for some strange reason when installing ceilometer and gnocchi
the mysqld process is killed by the oom killer of the operating system
this happens only in the gate and not localy on my devstack.

for now we won't enable the ceilometer plugin (which installs gnocchi)

Change-Id: If870b80456d8ebd4877253d977b5c59a11ad1c16

subject: Fix HAProxy precheck when VIP NIC has no IP address.
messages:
[{'account_id': 23084, 'date': '2020-09-07 19:24:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23084, 'date': '2020-09-07 19:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 32067, 'date': '2020-09-08 01:14:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 32029, 'date': '2020-09-08 06:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-09-08 07:17:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

But... it's not about the lack of an IP address, it's about no routability. No routability *will* cause issues."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-09-08 07:18:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Could you elaborate on a scenario where this is required?'}, {'account_id': 23084, 'date': '2020-09-08 08:09:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Could you elaborate on a scenario where this is required?

Kayobe's Multinode kolla-ansible deployment without IP address assigned to dedicated external VIP interface (because of scarce public address pool, plus narrows down potential attack vector) 
Only keepalived IP is available on one controller plus custom routing table. In this setup haproxy precheck will fail.

[root@controller-1 ~]# ip link show bond0.39
26: bond0.39@bond0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 9000 qdisc noqueue state UP mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000
    link/ether MAC_ADDR brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
[root@controller-1 ~]# ip route show table public
default via GW-IP dev bond0.39
GWNET/MASK dev bond0.39 scope link
[root@controller-1 ~]# ping VIP_IP
connect: Network is unreachable
[root@controller-1 ~]# echo $?
2"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-09-08 08:25:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Could you elaborate on a scenario where this is required?
 > 
 > Kayobe's Multinode kolla-ansible deployment without IP address
 > assigned to dedicated external VIP interface (because of scarce
 > public address pool, plus narrows down potential attack vector)
 > Only keepalived IP is available on one controller plus custom
 > routing table. In this setup haproxy precheck will fail.
 > 
 > [root@controller-1 ~]# ip link show bond0.39
 > 26: bond0.39@bond0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 9000
 > qdisc noqueue state UP mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000
 > link/ether MAC_ADDR brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
 > [root@controller-1 ~]# ip route show table public
 > default via GW-IP dev bond0.39
 > GWNET/MASK dev bond0.39 scope link
 > [root@controller-1 ~]# ping VIP_IP
 > connect: Network is unreachable
 > [root@controller-1 ~]# echo $?
 > 2

The GWNET/MASK should be part of the main routing table, otherwise you will have issues with local services trying to reach the external VIP address which will be unroutable everywhere except on the current keepalived master."}, {'account_id': 23084, 'date': '2020-09-08 08:52:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > > Could you elaborate on a scenario where this is required?
 > >
 > > Kayobe's Multinode kolla-ansible deployment without IP address
 > > assigned to dedicated external VIP interface (because of scarce
 > > public address pool, plus narrows down potential attack vector)
 > > Only keepalived IP is available on one controller plus custom
 > > routing table. In this setup haproxy precheck will fail.
 > >
 > > [root@controller-1 ~]# ip link show bond0.39
 > > 26: bond0.39@bond0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 9000
 > > qdisc noqueue state UP mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000
 > > link/ether MAC_ADDR brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
 > > [root@controller-1 ~]# ip route show table public
 > > default via GW-IP dev bond0.39
 > > GWNET/MASK dev bond0.39 scope link
 > > [root@controller-1 ~]# ping VIP_IP
 > > connect: Network is unreachable
 > > [root@controller-1 ~]# echo $?
 > > 2
 > 
 > The GWNET/MASK should be part of the main routing table, otherwise
 > you will have issues with local services trying to reach the
 > external VIP address which will be unroutable everywhere except on
 > the current keepalived master.

Which services are going to reach public endpoints? I suppose internal endpoint should be reached by local services?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-09-08 09:02:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd say Heat and Magnum, possibly others. The general assumption is that it is routable."}, {'account_id': 23084, 'date': '2020-09-09 07:15:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-09-15 09:46:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > > Could you elaborate on a scenario where this is required?
 > >
 > > Kayobe's Multinode kolla-ansible deployment without IP address
 > > assigned to dedicated external VIP interface (because of scarce
 > > public address pool, plus narrows down potential attack vector)
 > > Only keepalived IP is available on one controller plus custom
 > > routing table. In this setup haproxy precheck will fail.
 > >
 > > [root@controller-1 ~]# ip link show bond0.39
 > > 26: bond0.39@bond0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 9000
 > > qdisc noqueue state UP mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000
 > > link/ether MAC_ADDR brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
 > > [root@controller-1 ~]# ip route show table public
 > > default via GW-IP dev bond0.39
 > > GWNET/MASK dev bond0.39 scope link
 > > [root@controller-1 ~]# ping VIP_IP
 > > connect: Network is unreachable
 > > [root@controller-1 ~]# echo $?
 > > 2
 > 
 > The GWNET/MASK should be part of the main routing table, otherwise
 > you will have issues with local services trying to reach the
 > external VIP address which will be unroutable everywhere except on
 > the current keepalived master.

The 'connected' route only exists when the VIP is active. Otherwise if it is necessary to access the public VIP then this will need to be via some other route, e.g. the default route."}, {'account_id': 23084, 'date': '2020-09-17 09:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I agree, lack of default route is a not a best practice'}]

commit_message:
Fix HAProxy precheck when VIP NIC has no IP address.

'failed_when: ping_output.rc != 1' condition is failing
when VIP interface is configured without IP address
Added exit code 2 as an acceptable one.

Change-Id: Ied0356bd2bb90340c4bba6d6ab65e3830d283224
Closes-Bug: #1894716

subject: Fix grubenv link in latest grub2 CentOS packages (EFI)
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22629, 'name': 'Michal Nasiadka', 'email': 'mnasiadka@gmail.com', 'username': 'mnasiadka'}, {'_account_id': 23084, 'name': 'Bartosz Bezak', 'email': 'bartosz@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'b.bezak'}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-08-26 10:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-08-26 10:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-08-27 10:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-08-28 06:14:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

thanks for looking into this.  i'm trying to bring up a host environment with efi to get some testing in too.  we have https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1871669 (that might be private) which is perhaps related."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-08-28 07:26:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> thanks for looking into this.  i'm trying to bring up a host
 > environment with efi to get some testing in too.  we have
 > https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1871669 (that might be
 > private) which is perhaps related.

Yes, that's not private.
Main problem is - that with having both grub-pc and efi packages installed - when you install the grub2-efi-* package, it tries to put /boot/grub2/grubenv as a link to the efi dir, but if grubenv exists during installation (and it does, because DIB first updates existing packages (including grub2-pc), and then installs efi) - the link ends up as /boot/grub2/grubenv.rpmnew - and then EFI boot (with grub2 prefix set to /boot/efi/EFI/centos) can't find grubenv, so even if /boot/efi/EFI/centos/grub.cfg exists - it will fail to mount sysroot, due to missing root device assignment from grubenv.
Second thing, is that DIB does grub2-mkconfig to /boot/grub2/grub.cfg - so due to grub2 prefix set to efi dir - we're updating the wrong one on EFI - that's why the grub.cfg linking approach."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-09-01 06:41:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'd love to replicate this.  For me, the defaults seem to work and boot (I mentioned in bug).  Can you give some more details of how you're building?"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-09-08 07:19:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I can not replicate this.

I have build the centos element, using the upstream CentOS-8-GenericCloud-8.2.2004-20200611.2.x86_64.qcow2, with the following:

 DIB_RELEASE=8 disk-image-create vm centos block-device-efi

I import the resulting image file into KVM and switch the boot type to EFI, and it boots OK to a console for me.

However, I did see a problem building RHEL; it appears that the RHEL 8.2-update2 .qcow2 images have moved to an EFI layout, which leaves a dangling symlink that kills grub-install.  The layouts are described at [1].  I've proposed [2] to work around this.

So to avoid possibly making things worse, I'd really like to understand how we can get a solid reproduction of this before we put in workarounds.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/797556/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750279/"}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-09-17 09:35:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-26 10:36:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix grubenv link in latest grub2 CentOS packages (EFI)

After package-installs run with grub2 element, CentOS is not UEFI bootable.
New grub2-efi-* packages put grubenv as a link to /boot/efi/EFI/centos, and
if previous grubenv file exists - it won't move it, just leave the link as
grubenv.rpmnew. This leads to unbootable system via UEFI.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1812213

Change-Id: I8a100e8006702afab325ec03106d4ed7119b04e2
"}, {'created': '2020-08-26 10:42:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix grubenv link in latest grub2 CentOS packages (EFI)

After package-installs run with grub2 element, CentOS is not UEFI bootable.
New grub2-efi-* packages put grubenv as a link to /boot/efi/EFI/centos, and
if previous grubenv file exists - it won't move it, just leave the link as
grubenv.rpmnew. This leads to unbootable system via UEFI.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1812213

Change-Id: I8a100e8006702afab325ec03106d4ed7119b04e2
Closes-Bug: #1893029
"}, {'created': '2020-08-27 10:25:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix grubenv link in latest grub2 CentOS packages (EFI)

After package-installs run with grub2 element, CentOS is not UEFI bootable.
New grub2-efi-* packages put grubenv as a link to /boot/efi/EFI/centos, and
if previous grubenv file exists - it won't move it, just leave the link as
grubenv.rpmnew. This leads to unbootable system via UEFI.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1812213

Change-Id: I8a100e8006702afab325ec03106d4ed7119b04e2
Closes-Bug: #1893029
"}]
commit_message:
Fix grubenv link in latest grub2 CentOS packages (EFI)

After package-installs run with grub2 element, CentOS is not UEFI bootable.
New grub2-efi-* packages put grubenv as a link to /boot/efi/EFI/centos, and
if previous grubenv file exists - it won't move it, just leave the link as
grubenv.rpmnew. This leads to unbootable system via UEFI.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1812213

Change-Id: I8a100e8006702afab325ec03106d4ed7119b04e2
Closes-Bug: #1893029

Also a side note I wondering why this project doesn't have a github mirror, I'm not how work this part."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-18 18:03:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

deliverables/victoria/barbican-ansible-roles.yaml: validate_bugtracker: No launchpad or storyboard project given
deliverables/victoria/barbican-ansible-roles.yaml: validate_release_type: openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml no release job specified for openstack/ansible-role-lunasa-hsm, one of ['publish-to-pypi'] needs to be included in [] or no release will be published"}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-05-19 19:16:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-05-19 19:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-05-26 14:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-26 14:28:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-05-26 21:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-05-26 21:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-27 16:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Is there a patch to add this to governance? 

https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L1874

openstack/releases is only for officially governed projects, so it either needs to be added as one, or tagging needs to be handled by the team directly.'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-05-27 18:12:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

Hi Sean,  Thanks for reviewing this patch so often!  Yes, this repository for HSM management is already listed under the Barbican team.  I talked to the folks on the OpenStack Ansible team, and their preference was that our team keep ownership because they don't have the knowledge or hardware to test this role.

https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L51

I'll also be moving the two existing HSM roles under the barbican team in the near future."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-27 19:00:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I think I see the problem. The deliverable was defined as barbican-ansible-roles in governance, but this one is named ansible-role-lunasa-hsm. So I think the deliverable file just needs to be renamed.'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-06-04 20:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-08 18:00:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Docs fix has gone through, but we still need the governance change to merge since the validation job doesn't work with depends-on patches. commit_message:
ironic-pxe: RHEL/CentOS: install AArch64 modules on all GRUB architectures

grub2-efi-aa64-modules ships in RHEL and CentOS on all GRUB
architectures (x86_64, ppc64le, aarch64, but not s390x), and therefore
can be used on any of them to support heterogeneous clusters with AArch64.

Change-Id: Icf7e7bfddec89c4aec89410884480539b6bbfd74

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-10 09:39:07.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie55b92fa30c74882f19cfc41037e8117d75950de
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie55b92fa30c74882f19cfc41037e8117d75950de

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Ibc047731bf08644197c462a66b4e3fe061c4746e
Sem-Ver: feature

Comment inline.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-09-12 15:33:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

I'll summarize real quickly my concern about the DB design and the introduction of an 'is_active' column.  Intuitively, 'is_active' == True is already indicated by 'deleted' == False.  The problem it's being introduced to solve here is to be able to have a uniqueness constraint on project_id (since there's only supposed to be one of these active for any project_id); we need to account for deleted rows.  But this table is different from the volumes or snapshots tables in that rows don't represent entities, they represent a relation between a project and a volume_type.  So whereas keeping deleted volumes around in the DB may make sense because they are records of entities that existed at one time, this default_types table is an entirely different thing.  My thought is that this table really just needs a uniqueness constraint on project_id (as a backup for a bug in the code), and we handle things like this: for set/update (same operation in this API), make a model_query with read_deleted='yes' and if there's a row present, use it (setting all columns appropriately); otherwise create it (setting all columns appropriately).  I think all the other calls will work correctly based on the value of 'deleted'.

I just want to make sure we really need this extra layer of complexity before we add it."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2020-09-14 11:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

(3 comments)

@Brian, the reason for that DB nuisance is to keep records of previous default types, just like we keep them for old volume types (which don't represent entities either).

I think that, besides the value of having a consistent behavior with the soft deletes in the DB, it may also have value when investigating some situations, as we can know what the default type was at some point in time.

If we decide we don't want to keep old records, I would prefer we did hard deletes instead of soft deletes with "resurrections".'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-09-14 14:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

> If we decide we don't want to keep old records, I would prefer we did hard deletes instead of soft deletes with "resurrections".

I agree with this.  We have a precedent with the workers table: https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/src/commit/e4103150748a07e00c101a058d5a835bc833c95c/cinder/db/api.py#L1777-L1779  This should really simplify the DB code for the default_types table, and it's appropriate because all it records is a relation between a project and a volume_type that either holds or doesn't.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2020-09-14 20:08:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2020-09-14 20:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

'}, {'created': '2020-08-12 15:38:15.000000000', 'message': 'Default type overrides

This patch adds a feature by which we allow setting default volume types
for projects.
The following changes are made to achieve the feature:

1) Add 4 set of APIs, set, get, get_all, unset volume type
2) Policies that defaults to system admin for all operations
3) Preference order: project default, conf default
4) Logic to not allow deletion of default type

We validate set, get and unset APIs with keystone to verify a valid
project id is passed in the request and user has proper authorization
rights to show the project.

The policies are system admin by default but a new rule is available
to allow this for domain and project admins as well.

Implements: Blueprint multiple-default-volume-types

Change-Id: Idcc949ed6adbaea0c2337fac83014998b81ff1f8

commit_message:
Default type overrides

This patch adds a feature by which we allow setting default volume types
for projects.
The following changes are made to achieve the feature:

1) Add 4 set of APIs, set, get, get_all, unset volume type
2) All policies (except get_all) default to system/domain/project admin
3) Preference order: project default, conf default
4) Logic to not allow deletion of default type

We validate set, get and unset APIs with keystone to verify a valid
project id is passed in the request and user has proper authorization
rights to show the project.

The policies are system/domain/project admin by default except get_all
policy which defaults to system admin.

Implements: Blueprint multiple-default-volume-types

Change-Id: Idcc949ed6adbaea0c2337fac83014998b81ff1f8

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not needed
to be installed at run-time.

Change-Id: I347d6b24bb66bbe9ff11ab9eb3a59a730bcca539
(cherry picked from commit d399fe717b9185da06d9f3dd42117294aaf3f2cc)

commit_message:
Enable worker-multiplier for wsgi

So that users can have a control over the number of processes to be
spawend and database connections to be consumed.

Change-Id: I7ffdafb807a604d89381a2fecaba8300f00e9691
Closes-Bug: #1677543

[{'created': '2020-06-07 10:46:45.000000000', 'message': 'Get rid of chunked body

Using a chunked body is problematic in
that requests will not able to calculate
content-length automatically. And this will
lead to possibly dramatically slow down of
creating images using cinder store. Sometimes
it will lead to failure if unfortunately
specified volume type does not allow live
resizing (for example active-active volume
for as5600 from fujitsu does not support
resizing).

So instead of trunk every input flow, user
should determine themselves if they would
like to have a chunked data body or not.

Closes-Bug: #1220197

commit_message:
Get rid of chunked body

Using a chunked body is problematic in
that requests will not able to calculate
content-length automatically. And this will
lead to possibly dramatically slow down of
creating images using cinder store. Sometimes
it will lead to failure if unfortunately
specified volume type does not allow live
resizing (for example active-active volume
for as5600 from fujitsu does not support
resizing).

So instead of trunk every input flow, user
should determine themselves if they would
like to have a chunked data body or not.

Change-Id: I00eda1ced9a364be3c636eee248629b91d7b6282
Closes-Bug: #1220197

commit_message:
Consume ceph, prom, grafana containers from quay.io

In order to reduce dependency from docker.io. it switched to
the registry url of following containers to quay.io:
ceph - quay.ceph.io/ceph-ci
alertmanager, prometheus and node-exporter - quay.io/prometheus
grafana - quay.io/app-sre

It also updates the ceph daemon image tag from
v4.0.12-stable-4.0-nautilus-centos-7-x86_64
to v4.0.13-stable-4.0-nautilus-centos-7-x86_64.

Change-Id: I8be781e49765cd800f8a10b028ab1574292fdc67
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adjust API tests for NotImplemented skip

This is a patch to restructure the API tests to use the
new skip_if_not_implemented capability.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/745239

commit_message:
Drop diskimage-builder from root requirements.txt

diskimage-builder is already listed in diskimage-create/requirements.txt,
and it isn't really a run-time dependency for octavia so it tends to be
confusing downstream as we generally add run-time dependencies based on
the root requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I612ea1c583090897bd44453b867d75929a01b7fc
Story: 2007934
Task: 40389

commit_message:
Also wipe agent token on manual power off or reboot

We have a check in the code that is never true for manual power
actions because of what happens in the conductor manager. Remove it.

Change-Id: I50b7b78a41188c41e4944894851f1d12684f824a

commit_message:
Add polling-batch-size config option

Samples collected can be batched together,
consequently increasing or reducing the
amount of API calls and body data
sent to the configured publisher.

This config is available since Rocky,
adding the config option to allow its
tuning.

Change-Id: I0e3f756aa0305d3a96e21c7498d6a56208c51007
Closes-bug: #1885190

commit_message:
Remove chrony if inside a container

When running ceph-mon in containers, best practice is
to have chrony/ntp configured and installed on the bare
metal and then have the container trust the system
clock, as the container should not manage the system
clock.

The chrony package get installed automatically as
part of the dependencies of other packages, which
gets removed in this change.

ceph-mon charm will use this change here to remove
the chrony package.

Change-Id: Ie3c9c5899c1d46edd21c32868938d3290db321e7
Closes-Bug: #1852441

commit_message:
Add focal-victoria to the test gate

Also reduce chances of spurious mysql-innodb-cluster "super-read-only"
failures.

Change-Id: Idbee09f4949dbf64dc09b86cc1c7e9b1b97722cf
Partial-Bug: #1882205

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-14 01:57:14.000000000', 'message': 'Ensute root isn't used to run updates/upgrades

The updates and upgrades operations should not be executed as "root"
user, and the operator should use the regular deployment user (e.g.
"stack").

This enforces this expected behavior.

commit_message:
Ensure root isn't used to run updates/upgrades

The updates and upgrades operations should not be executed as "root"
user, and the operator should use the regular deployment user (e.g.
"stack").

This enforces this expected behavior.

Change-Id: If23f12d6ab571bc3a3b41aef3dcbd58f98d80977

commit_message:
Fix pathing for container image prepare

When we pass the paths to the ansible playbook, they need to be absolute
paths as the relative cwd changes when it runs.

Change-Id: I8a434e38eb1a69530190df96d3b555ea14e4488a
Closes-Bug: #1895194

commit_message:
Deprecate images for Victoria

Deprecates support for the certmonger, ec2-api, novajoin, ptp, radvd,
rsyslog and zaqar images. In Wallaby support for these images will be
removed from Kolla. No known downstream projects use these images.

Change-Id: Iccee089b5f659f79eb851ae539cb365539d18d63

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: I5ae59e6ef0aa0a3e9b8ca9482f02240f234e3339
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Remove Babel requirement

Babel is no longer a requirement for OpenStack projects.
we need remove it and save some disk space.

Change-Id: Ibd4789c36ed1dc52ffc43a300a4005542d2a1de3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-16 22:42:32.000000000', 'message': "Prevent openstack-tox-py27 from running on focal

While we don't want to be using bionic across all stable branches, focal
doesn't have py27 available. Use xenial for pre-stein, and bionic for
stein and later.

Change-Id: I206b95ee9240345e91229921b6cf14e13f36d254
Related-Change: I7c597c4aa5aeb3b1bb7987efb4afd0c5c15d86e6
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent openstack-tox-py27 from running on focal

While we don't want to be using bionic across all stable branches, focal
doesn't have py27 available. Use xenial for pre-stein, and bionic for
stein and later.

Change-Id: I206b95ee9240345e91229921b6cf14e13f36d254
Related-Change: I7c597c4aa5aeb3b1bb7987efb4afd0c5c15d86e6

[{'created': '2020-09-16 10:14:27.000000000', 'message': "tests: Add regression test for bug 1894966

You must specify the 'policies' field. Currently, not doing so will
result in a HTTP 500 error code. This should be a 4xx error. Add a test
to demonstrate the bug before we provide a fix.

Change-Id: I72e85855f621d3a51cd58d14247abd302dcd958b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1894966
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Add regression test for bug 1894966

You must specify the 'policies' field. Currently, not doing so will
result in a HTTP 500 error code. This should be a 4xx error. Add a test
to demonstrate the bug before we provide a fix.

Change-Id: I72e85855f621d3a51cd58d14247abd302dcd958b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1894966

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate tox based testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40177
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738328/

Change-Id: I046e2bf0e730849ef6fd8b8d1d355916632a467e

commit_message:
Fix pep8 checks for Ubuntu Focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal,
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing the pep8 checks which fail on Ubuntu Focal.

we can see the failure in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/744599/

Change-Id: Ie7120073aa83608ec4794986b4a51d3060dc58ec
Story: #2007865
Task: #402218

commit_message:
Sync logging values with upstream repos

Some OSH charts have diffferent values for logger_root
handler from upsgream repo config defaul values.
Exactly, logger_root handler values.
This leads double logging finally.
To fix this, set logger_root as null like upstream repos.

Change-Id: I20e4f48efe29ae59c56f74e0ed9a4085283de6ad

subject: proxy: Include thread_locals when spawning _fragment_GET_request
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-01 18:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-01 18:23:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Manual testing is pretty easy: upload some EC data, then edit your proxy-server.conf to have node_timeout=0, restart proxy, and watch your logs while you try to GET it. Before:

 2020-09-01T18:02:48.305652+00:00 saio proxy-server: ERROR with Object server 127.0.0.3:6038/sdb11 re: Trying to GET /v1/AUTH_test/c/tox.ini: Timeout (1.0s)
 2020-09-01T18:02:48.306310+00:00 saio proxy-server: ERROR with Object server 127.0.0.1:6018/sdb9 re: Trying to GET /v1/AUTH_test/c/tox.ini: Timeout (1.0s)
 ...

After:

 2020-09-01T18:08:53.625843+00:00 saio proxy-server: ERROR with Object server 127.0.0.1:6018/sdb9 re: Trying to GET /v1/AUTH_test/c/tox.ini: Timeout (0.0s) (txn: tx5758b25cee854df99a616-005f4e8e35)
 2020-09-01T18:08:53.626416+00:00 saio proxy-server: ERROR with Object server 127.0.0.1:6016/sdb1 re: Trying to GET /v1/AUTH_test/c/tox.ini: Timeout (0.0s) (txn: tx5758b25cee854df99a616-005f4e8e35)
 ...

It's a little strange, though: sometimes I get a client IP as well, and sometimes I don't -- even within the same client request!"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-02 18:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-02 18:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(2 comments)

Code was already amazing and functionally easy to verify - i just did the rebase and updated the test infra cause "why not"'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-02 18:41:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Bah, with the waterfall EC changes, there's another caller now."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-02 19:18:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1 -Workflow

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-02 19:48:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-02 19:57:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-08 22:01:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-08 22:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Just a rebase.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-16 18:58:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(4 comments)

oh right, we shipped this and I'm sure it's fine - but I'm confused about the extra set of plumbing into ECFragGetter.

I tried to pull it out:

	diff --git a/swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py b/swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py
	index 603cf8631..73f5dd3de 100644
	--- a/swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py
	+++ b/swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py
	@@ -2348,7 +2348,7 @@ def is_good_source(status):
	 class ECFragGetter(object):
	 
	     def __init__(self, app, req, node_iter, partition, policy, path,
	-                 backend_headers, header_provider, logger_thread_locals):
	+                 backend_headers, header_provider):
		 self.app = app
		 self.req = req
		 self.node_iter = node_iter
	@@ -2361,7 +2361,6 @@ class ECFragGetter(object):
		 self.skip_bytes = 0
		 self.bytes_used_from_backend = 0
		 self.source = None
	-        self.logger_thread_locals = logger_thread_locals
	 
	     def fast_forward(self, num_bytes):
		 """
	@@ -2707,7 +2706,6 @@ class ECFragGetter(object):
		     return HeaderKeyDict()
	 
	     def _make_node_request(self, node, node_timeout):
	-        self.app.logger.thread_locals = self.logger_thread_locals
		 req_headers = dict(self.backend_headers)
		 ip, port = get_ip_port(node, req_headers)
		 req_headers.update(self.header_provider())


... and I get a test failure:

	======================================================================
	FAIL: test_GET_read_timeout_resume (test.unit.proxy.controllers.test_obj.TestECObjController)
	----------------------------------------------------------------------
	Traceback (most recent call last):
	  File "/home/vagrant/swift/test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py", line 4156, in test_GET_read_timeout_resume
	    self.assertIn(req.headers['x-trans-id'], retry_line)
	AssertionError: 'txa59ab1ea899747a28db45-005f625fe9' not found in u'proxy-server ERROR: Trying to read object during GET (retrying) 10.0.0.1:1001/sdb'
	-------------------- >> begin captured stdout << ---------------------
	proxy-server DEBUG: Loaded override config for (default): ProxyOverrideOptions({}, {'sorting_method': 'shuffle', 'read_affinity': '', 'write_affinity': '', 'write_affinity_node_count': '2 * replicas', 'write_affinity_handoff_delete_count': None, 'concurrent_gets': False, 'concurrency_timeout': 1.0, 'concurrent_ec_extra_requests': 0}, app) (txn: txn1) (client_ip: 127.0.0.2)
	proxy-server ERROR: Trying to read object during GET (retrying) 10.0.0.1:1001/sdb


but I STILL can't figure out where we loosing the locals?  Any pointers?'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-16 19:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

eventlet melts my brain sometimes'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-16 23:57:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

recheck

This definitely seems like an improvement, but the thread_locals thing is such a hack -- I'm amazed it works as well as it does. I should maybe look at using eventlet.corolocal.local ..."}]

commit_message:
proxy: Include thread_locals when spawning _fragment_GET_request

Otherwise, we miss out on transaction id and client IP information when
timeouts pop.

Closes-Bug: #1892421
Change-Id: I6dea3ccf780bcc703db8447a2ef13c33838ff12d

Add chart-testing linter

Added chart lint in zuul CI to enhance the stability for charts.
Fixed some lint errors in the current charts.

subject: Update testing to Ubuntu Focal
messages:
[{'account_id': 32389, 'date': '2020-09-06 11:05:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-09-06 11:05:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 32389, 'date': '2020-09-06 11:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-09-07 13:18:14.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to migrate-to-focal'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-09-08 17:46:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Update testing to Ubuntu Focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal,
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Bump lower constraints to make testing work for Focal.


Change-Id: I32a4a3055595eeafb330c14959e55db9ee82cfa9
Story: #2007865
Task: #402184

Run tripleo-build-containers-ubi-8 on BuildahBuilder code

the tripleo-build-containers-ubi-8 job as well, it provides quick
results on how we build the images with Buildah.

commit_message:
Run tripleo-build-containers-ubi-8 on BuildahBuilder code

When patching the BuildahBuilder, it would be nice to get feedback from
the tripleo-build-containers-ubi-8 job as well, it provides quick
results on how we build the images with Buildah.

Change-Id: I99a05d14373976fb178b8d5822a854ccf786d231
(cherry picked from commit 9848dadc0f5205dd2ef8f29f017480d3b9daf4e2)

commit_message:
Remove OVN floating IP deletion of associated LSP

When a floating IP is created or updated, and a router is defined,
a NAT rule is created in OVN NB. There is not logical switch port
associated to a floating IP, that means there is no need to
remove any LSP associated.

Change-Id: Icaf04f0b9184c153fa6b3fe218c889fd5684b3f0

[{'created': '2020-09-15 07:44:39.000000000', 'message': 'Make service desc in keystone::endpoint configurable

I have a issue when upgrading a Train deployment to
Ussuri because the migration to keystone::bootstrap
did not cover the fact that the service description
was set on the keystone_service.

This means that if you migrate to using
keystone::bootstrap it will ensure_resource() on
the keystone_service which defaults the desc to an
empty string causing it to not be idempotent.

This can be avoided by changing the service desc
to match the keystone::bootstrap behavior to a empty
string but this cannot be done since this is hardcoded.

The alternative to this is to change the behavior in
ussuri and master which would instead break deployments
that has worked around that issue already.

Change-Id: I307583b0f88dbedf9aa4fa02eda61533fd863c4b
'}, {'created': '2020-09-16 12:17:22.000000000', 'message': 'Make service desc in keystone::endpoint configurable

Change-Id: I307583b0f88dbedf9aa4fa02eda61533fd863c4b

commit_message:
Make service desc in keystone::endpoint configurable

I have a issue when upgrading a Train deployment to
Ussuri because the migration to keystone::bootstrap
did not cover the fact that the service description
was set on the keystone_service.

This means that if you migrate to using
keystone::bootstrap it will ensure_resource() on
the keystone_service which defaults the desc to an
empty string causing it to not be idempotent.

This can be avoided by changing the service desc
to match the keystone::bootstrap behavior to a empty
string but this cannot be done since this is hardcoded.

The alternative to this is to change the behavior in
ussuri and master which would instead break deployments
that has worked around that issue already.

Change-Id: I307583b0f88dbedf9aa4fa02eda61533fd863c4b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-08 06:55:26.000000000', 'message': 'bootloader: remove dangling grubenv links

The rhel8.2 .qcow2 images have moved from a single xfs partition into
an EFI style layout with separate /boot/efi partition.

This means the root partition has /boot/grub2/grubenv as a symlink to
../efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv, which is dangling when we are running the
bootloader element as /boot/efi is blank.  grub-install tries to call
rename() in the process of re-writing this file, which fails and bails
out dib.

Remove this symlink if it exists

Change-Id: I5591144a3617dbae148b0c5d2a6a404942ffcd4e
Parital-Bug: #1893029
Redhat-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1871669
'}, {'created': '2020-09-08 07:31:59.000000000', 'message': 'bootloader: remove dangling grubenv links

commit_message:
bootloader: remove dangling grubenv links

The rhel8.2 .qcow2 images have moved from a single xfs partition into
an EFI style layout with separate /boot/efi partition.

This means the root partition has /boot/grub2/grubenv as a symlink to
../efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv, which is dangling when we are running the
bootloader element as /boot/efi is blank.  grub-install tries to call
rename() in the process of re-writing this file, which fails and bails
out dib.

Remove this symlink if it exists

Change-Id: I5591144a3617dbae148b0c5d2a6a404942ffcd4e
Parital-Bug: #1893029
Redhat-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1871669

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

commit_message:
Change the doc8 check mode

In Ib226cbf9fc1fb7d3146083d65c44d8e0b80e2a7b we were introduced the doc8
check, but the configuration in cyborg/tox.ini is incorrect. This patch
will combine the doc8 check in [testenv:docs] to fix 'tox -e doc8' error.

Story: 2008084
Task: 40785

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not needed
to be installed at run-time.

Change-Id: I347d6b24bb66bbe9ff11ab9eb3a59a730bcca539

commit_message:
Install gzip instead of busybox-gzip on suse

e2fsprogs pulls in info which needs gzip. But that conflicts with the
preexisting busybox-gzip. Install normal gzip to ensure that things can
proceed without conflict.

Change-Id: I3bed5bc141eaa0f3a15bfbf9da3e2d6e7c964a76

commit_message:
[ovn]: Use assertCountEqual instead of assertEqual when appropriate

Fix unit test for ovn port forwarding to:
- Use assertCountEqual to ignore the order of the content when it should;
- Fix (expected, actual) parameters in assertEqual

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0bbea25861b078a0da8b8feaa4a6251527cc5979
Signed-off-by: Flavio Fernandes <flaviof@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: I3381d14c6bb71d06bb7b5ebcbace61d0f54f47e3
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Use the 'all' tox env instead of 'all-plugin'

As the 'all-plugin' tox env is deprecated it is recommended to use
'all' tox env instead.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/543974/
Related-Bug: #1862240

Change-Id: Icc95ceadcd380aefe6b1cd9a5db4d200c24196cd

From v2.1 API until microversion 2.63, empty 'policies' was anyways
wrong request. Which has been fixed in v2.64 by converting the array

commit_message:
Add warning to os-server-groups POST api

From v2.1 API until microversion 2.63, empty 'policies' was anyways
wrong request. Which has been fixed in v2.64 by converting the array
type to string field, and renamed ``policies`` field to ``policy``.

Closes-Bug: #1894966

Change-Id: I53b50a4472b614f76e799411c13f48a4acc4170e

commit_message:
Set install of ipa packages to false - use local forwarder

multinode-ipa job has been failing spordically on package
installs during the run of the undercloud-ipa-install.yaml
playbook. These package installs should not be required as
dependencies for TLS are installed earlier.
This patch sets the package installs to false to avoid
the sporadic failures.

This package also gets the local cloud DNS forwarder
rather than using 1.1.1.1 for all cases.

Change-Id: I729982744a029e16b210c3db9021ccbfe583cbbb
Related-Bug: #1884570

commit_message:
Pass build_repo_dir + fix tempest cloud name for standalone upgrade

As discussed in related-bug we are failing during built-test-packages
As a workaround we can explicitly pass the build_repo_dir. 

Also fixes the tempest cloud name making it the same as used in the
tests running after deploy (and matching the standalone env).

Related-Bug: 1895138
Change-Id: I7e1868d5dea3863cfa15c5ef86b6666cac3b0370

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-15 08:27:40.000000000', 'message': 'Performance: refactor pip configuration

Currently we perform pip configuration for a list of users, including
pip_conf.yml in a loop for each user. It is slightly more efficient to
loop over each task, since individual tasks have a higher overhead than
loops.

This change refactors the code into multiple loops, with a single
include. We keep the include to allow skipping the tasks when pip
configuration is not required.

Change-Id: I698d38613f45bd03a2e51572f6e6fb69e934f614
Story: 2007993
Task: 40719
(cherry picked from commit 43650cb966daf6dd059d44d3e7bd0fc1b0dac945)
'}]
commit_message:
Performance: refactor pip configuration

Currently we perform pip configuration for a list of users, including
pip_conf.yml in a loop for each user. It is slightly more efficient to
loop over each task, since individual tasks have a higher overhead than
loops.

This change refactors the code into multiple loops, with a single
include. We keep the include to allow skipping the tasks when pip
configuration is not required.

Change-Id: I698d38613f45bd03a2e51572f6e6fb69e934f614
Story: 2007993
Task: 40719
(cherry picked from commit 43650cb966daf6dd059d44d3e7bd0fc1b0dac945)

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate tox based testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40177
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738328/

Change-Id: I046e2bf0e730849ef6fd8b8d1d355916632a467e

commit_message:
Removed the host FQDN from the exception message

Deletion of an instance after disabling the hypervisor by a non-admin
 user leaks the host fqdn in fault msg of instance.Removing the
'host' field from the error message of HypervisorUnavaiable
cause it's leaking host fqdn to non-admin users. The admin user will
see the Hypervisor unavailable exception msg but will be able to figure
on which compute host the guest is on and that the connection is broken.

Conflicts:
    nova/virt/libvirt/host.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is because change
I7d2287ce06d77c0afdef0ea8bdfb70f6c52d3c50 is not in Rocky.

Change-Id: I0eae19399670f59c17c9a1a24e1bfcbf1b514e7b
Closes-Bug: #1851587
(cherry picked from commit a89ffab83261060bbb9dedb2b8de6297b2d07efd)
(cherry picked from commit ff82601204e9d724b3032dc94c49fa5c8de2699b)
(cherry picked from commit c5abbd17b5552209e53ad61713c4787f47f463c6)
(cherry picked from commit d5ff9f87c8af335e1f83476319a2540fead5224c)

for every node nested stack of a role.

commit_message:
Fix typo in spelling of "finalise", breaking build

Without this spelled properly, DIB does not run the pre
finalization script, rendering the feature nonfunctional.

Change-Id: Ided93ad85f6a71c2b7679a329404a575b9d90d61

commit_message:
[OVN] Zuul: Copy OVSDB logs and DBs

Prior to this patch the OVSDB NB/SB logs and databases weren't been
uploaded as part of the job's run. These files are important for
troubleshooting gate problems.

Change-Id: Ie2c9596d8b24e0e433a1ac0d27115369fc4cf8ef
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-11 02:24:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix error that cannot overwrite policy rule for 'forced_host'

When configure 'os_compute_api:servers:create:forced_host' to
'rule:admin_or_owner', but still doesn't allow.
In nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L669, the target is
set to '{}' that is not equal None, so then it will not be set
in nova/policy.py#L205.
This patch configures the target param.

Change-Id: I7a563386bd2f5d1930b5eb2cfc00425a19747e24
Closes-Bug: #1894975
"}]
commit_message:
Fix error that cannot overwrite policy rule for 'forced_host'

When configure 'os_compute_api:servers:create:forced_host' to
'rule:admin_or_owner', but still doesn't allow.
In nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L669, the target is
set to '{}' that is not equal None, so then it will not be set
in nova/policy.py#L205.
This patch configures the target param.

Change-Id: I7a563386bd2f5d1930b5eb2cfc00425a19747e24
Closes-Bug: #1894975

commit_message:
Inject both paths for validations roles location

We're in a weird state with validations roles in different locations.
Let's reflect it in the variables.
Also, let's point to a valid "groups.yaml" location.

Closes-Bug: #1895507
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752187/
Change-Id: Iee198b04f962a3a049515d7b70584f55413bba6f
(cherry picked from commit cbb798dde1729c84a2718552cb5c1d8a6e36acf1)

Add some volume tests to tempest_black_regex till
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1882521 is solved.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-15 14:35:18.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Fix test_add_interface_in_use negative test

While fixing https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1876148 we've made
the add_router_interface method idempotent and it no longer raised a
Conflict if the same interface was added twice, this broke the
test_add_interface_in_use from neutron-tempest-pluign.

This patch removes that behavior so that ML2/OVN adhere to the API's
expected behavior but also add an exception handled in the maintenance
code to keep the code from failing while fixing the router ports.

Change-Id: I76d46a4c3c8af166e022894a5693d5c78555ea50
Closes-Bug: #1895671
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-09-15 15:40:33.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Fix test_add_interface_in_use negative test

"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix test_add_interface_in_use negative test

While fixing https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1876148 we've made
the add_router_interface method idempotent and it no longer raised a
Conflict if the same interface was added twice, this broke the
test_add_interface_in_use from neutron-tempest-pluign.

Change-Id: I76d46a4c3c8af166e022894a5693d5c78555ea50
Closes-Bug: #1895671
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

subject: [train-only] Nullify podman-docker for CentOS/RHEL8 overcloud images
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8161, 'name': 'Lon Hohberger', 'email': 'lhh@redhat.com', 'username': 'lon'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25877, 'name': 'Luke Short', 'email': 'ekultails@gmail.com', 'username': 'ekultails'}]

[{'account_id': 8161, 'date': '2020-08-11 21:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8161, 'date': '2020-08-11 21:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-08-11 21:21:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

please use -x option when doing cherry pick, also please propose it to ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 8161, 'date': '2020-08-11 21:36:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Commit a5ca5d269d605eb232cc81f455f09e8d72d1911c is not on stable-train, so a direct cherry-pick wouldn't function the way we want (we'd end up trying to install docker and python-docker-py).

I can't state whether it makes sense to cherry-pick that here since it affects distributions apart from RHEL/CentOS.

I'll propose the above commit to stable/train and, pending others approving that one, resubmit this as an actual cherry-pick."}, {'account_id': 8161, 'date': '2020-08-11 21:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to drop-docker-from-oc'}, {'account_id': 8161, 'date': '2020-08-11 21:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from drop-docker-from-oc to drop-podman-from-oc'}, {'account_id': 8161, 'date': '2020-08-11 21:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8161, 'date': '2020-08-11 21:54:10.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from st to drop-podman-from-oc'}, {'account_id': 8161, 'date': '2020-08-11 22:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-08-17 16:01:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-08-17 17:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8161, 'date': '2020-09-16 14:04:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
[train-only] Nullify podman-docker for CentOS/RHEL8 overcloud images

Compared to master, the use of docker and python-docker-py were
not removed on stable/train tripleo-puppet-elements or THT.

However, podman-docker is no longer required, so we can nullify it
here to prevent it from being installed

Related: rhbz#1858372

Change-Id: I6896232cdc339f68d7f6eca807ef0925af45ae46
Signed-off-by: Lon Hohberger <lhh@redhat.com>

configure-swap role variable configure_swap_size[1.]
to 4096.

It also moves c7 containers multinode job to nv as
it is timing out and blocking the gates.

'}, {'created': '2020-09-16 07:15:31.000000000', 'message': 'Increase configure_swap_size to 8192

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750941/ changes
use dd and limit swap size to 1024MB in
openstack-zuul-jobs configure_swap role, caused
the OOM issue during container image prepare step.

Change-Id: I80c1ee16662fa4e50e46f864d0e70847731449df
Related-Bug: #1895290
Related-Bug: #1895288

commit_message:
Increase configure_swap_size to 8192

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750941/ changes
use dd and limit swap size to 1024MB in
openstack-zuul-jobs configure_swap role, caused
the OOM issue during container image prepare step.

Earlier the swap size was 8192, in order to fix that,
the configure-swap role variable configure_swap_size
is setted to 8192 at playbook level and remove the vars
defined at job level in https://review.opendev.org/751828

Change-Id: I80c1ee16662fa4e50e46f864d0e70847731449df
Related-Bug: #1895290
Related-Bug: #1895288
Signed-off-by: Bhagyashri Shewale <bshewale@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Release final python-tackerclient for victoria

Final victoria client lib release for the September 10 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave a -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to loand,
then update with a better commit hash to use for the release when
ready.

Patches with no response will be approved by September 14.

Change-Id: I98c93bf0806990d3cc3ada045606627fda222891
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7da2f6d8eca678a97f233d31404a06fae899319e

Add LUKS2 based encrypted volume tests

I09fb2b2be1e376f8ec0f49741c855cfd54ee27f0 introduces a new LUKS2 based
encryptor within os-brick. This change simply duplicates the existing
LUKS based tests to also cover this new encryptor.

commit_message:
Add Python3 wallaby unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for wallaby.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I8415ef2fc9a9f328d62ba5dbbb9b32433646e3c6

commit_message:
Add libssl devel package for CentOS and Suse

libssl-devel package is required to install scrypt for keystone venv,
which is direct keystone requirement [1]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L22

Change-Id: I43df6a6b70195e21e0845565d12aeed5a34d2cda

commit_message:
Refactored zuul jobs and converted to zuul v3 syntax

Removed all old style CI jobs and created new jobs that
work on Ubuntu 18.04 (and possibly 20.04 but untested yet)

networking-midonet-ml2-tempest-aio
networking-midonet-ml2-tempest-multinode

networking-midonet-ml2-tempest-aio-centos8 is not functional but
left here as non voting to be fixed up in a follow up commit

networking-midonet-ml2-grenade is also non voting as will need some
commits backported to stable branches to get working first before
making it voting.

Change-Id: I4db6cd9b8478018ef696c3e4d2ec9a92ccd50c7a

commit_message:
Get pep8 and py3 tox jobs working again

Includes several fixes:

1. Fix taas related unit tests

After meging https://review.opendev.org/681946 in tap-as-a-service
both tap_services and tap_flows has a new status field which can be
DOWN.

2. Return a 404 when network doesn't exist when creating a floating IP

3. Update pep8 config and dependencies to be the same as neutron

Change-Id: Ie174d1f701162a8d71b641ebedd2964d20f32c29
Co-authored-by: elajkat <lajos.katona@est.tech>

commit_message:
Update grenade job to run one smoke test

With the addition of many new test permutations, the grenade job
is taking more time to run.
Previously grenade ran one smoke test to test basic traffic.
This patch updated the grenade job to run the "smoke" test
labeled job.

Change-Id: Ieade64f62b26e8cf4742bc54c17774f61d9abe4c

[{'created': '2020-09-14 18:58:39.000000000', 'message': 'Install grep before busybox on suse distros

busybox-grep is pulled in by the base image and it conflicts with rsync
package installs because rsync needs grep proper. Install grep proper
prior to installing the base distro to avoid this issue later when
trying to install rsync.

Change-Id: I2ec2bf39a2af214443a93776231657b25035e54f
'}]
commit_message:
Install grep before busybox on suse distros

busybox-grep is pulled in by the base image and it conflicts with rsync
package installs because rsync needs grep proper. Install grep proper
prior to installing the base distro to avoid this issue later when
trying to install rsync.

Change-Id: I2ec2bf39a2af214443a93776231657b25035e54f

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: I0690391e0c47169b8397e250593644636d2a80a4
Sem-Ver: feature

Add basic tempest-integrated-networking job to os-ken ci

Os-ken is library which us used a lot in the Neutron so we should
be sure that new patches in os-ken will not break Neutron.
To ensure that this patch adds tempest-integrated-networking job to the
check and gate queues in os-ken.

Change-Id: I3e5db6b6c2a3147f96f759948be9a0fcba184209

API.

subject: Operator does not need to become for image prepare
messages:
[{'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-09-11 16:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-09-11 18:09:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

If you have push_destination: true, it's required. That's usually the only time to run this command as a standalone."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-09-11 18:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This might be a side effect of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/746477/'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-09-14 05:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> If you have push_destination: true, it's required. That's usually
 > the only time to run this command as a standalone.

I don't think it is mandatory, the actual playbook called within the CLI has proper "become":
https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/src/branch/master/tripleo_ansible/playbooks/cli-container-image-prepare.yaml#L54

Here we get the "ansible.log" with root:root, and we can't run following commands since "stack" wants to write in that very same file.
Not sure about the link to the other review you've pushed, doesn't sound like it's managing that "ansible.log"..'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-09-14 13:06:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't think we should be writing to $HOME/ansible.log. I think the issue is our usage of that not this sudo. This sudo is required for <= Ussiri"}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-09-16 08:07:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

quick update:
- become is NOT needed when applied on master
- it IS needed for osp-16.1

just tried it, and it works as expected under those conditions. Not sure about the best way to solve this issue - maybe we're just missing something in train/osp-16.1 allowing us to remove the become.. ?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-09-16 13:05:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

best solution: fix the ansible.log permissions problem so it doesn't matter.  Kevin has a patch for that"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-09-16 18:48:39.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Let's solve this bug using the following instead: 
 https://review.opendev.org/#/c/751859/"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-11 16:14:00.000000000', 'message': 'Operator does not need to become for image prepare

tripleo_container_image_prepare uses become already
so having tripleo-operator-ansible use become when
it runs it is not necessary. Also, using become for
this task in tripleo-operator-ansible can create the
bug this change closes.

Change-Id: Ife0d83aff935f068435ae8290130719921b604b0
Closes-Bug: #1895318
'}]
commit_message:
Operator does not need to become for image prepare

tripleo_container_image_prepare uses become already
so having tripleo-operator-ansible use become when
it runs it is not necessary. Also, using become for
this task in tripleo-operator-ansible can create the
bug this change closes.

Change-Id: Ife0d83aff935f068435ae8290130719921b604b0
Closes-Bug: #1895318

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave a -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to loand,
then update with a better commit hash to use for the release when
ready.

Patches with no response will be approved by September 14.

commit_message:
Update user/project referencing from context

The old context references (user, tenant) errors out during functional
testing on glance side[1][2] with the following error:

2020-09-07 07:29:34,125 ERROR [glance.async_.taskflow_executor] Failed to
execute task 6ee97c27-b87b-42f9-86af-151ef9a7ecd4: Property 'tenant' has
moved to 'project_id' in version '2.6' and will be removed in version '3.0'

(similar error for user/user_id)

This patch updates the same.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750144/
[2] https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_fdc/750144/2/check/openstack-tox-functional-py36/fdc43f4/testr_results.html

Closes-Bug: #1894735

Change-Id: I279e442d7d00a6ebca0679cbf46a295fa07b6306

commit_message:
Add a basic test framework for oslo.metrics

Add a noop test as a basic test framework.
Properly comment out the bandit line to not give the impression that
it's actually tested (it was misconfigured before).

Change-Id: Ic2278816d50ec0fa628f6616839f8b9dc0a5c299

commit_message:
Add functional-py38 job

The openstack-python3-victoria-jobs template is running unit tests
for py36 and py38.  We should do the same for our functional test
jobs.  So replace the functional-py37 job with a functional-py38
job.

Change-Id: Icb338611169975be04bb27b86b5b3de0a37a6f5f

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2020-04-29 12:37:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Summarizing major points
•	Mistral to be removed. Everyone agrees
•	Update the blueprint with alternative to mistral, see comments by alex and dave
•	It was noted that it is seen as 3rd party integration
•	New installations or Scaling up: Use virt-Customize and to inject the rpms into the overcloud-full-image for new installations
•	Update and Upgrades: Will rely on RPMs in a repo
•	Alan’s concern about having openstack services and vxflexos on same nodes has to be addressed
•	In-tree Vs Out of Tree?'}, {'account_id': 31779, 'date': '2020-05-12 16:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 10644, 'date': '2020-05-13 00:02:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

This is my recipe for upgrading from xenial to bionic on rocky by
reinstalling hosts one at a time. Possibly useful for others.

Feel free to update, clarify, improve upon syntax, question, comment or
whatever else.

commit_message:
How to upgrade from xenial to bionic on rocky

This is my recipe for upgrading from xenial to bionic on rocky by
reinstalling hosts one at a time. Possibly useful for others.

This is placed to stable/rocky, because xenial->bionic upgrade
should be performed on rocky release.

Change-Id: I13903aed7863d311cf7bc7f7784222785608b3dc

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-16 13:29:27.000000000', 'message': "docs: Improve 'AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation' docs

When we introduced the 'ImageMetaProps' o.vo in Liberty, we lost the
ability to consume arbitrary metadata configured for images. This
affects users of the 'AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation' filter, who may
have set such arbitrary metadata and expected their instances to be
restricted to host aggregates matching that metadata.

The world has changed a lot since Liberty was released, and it's
probably too late and maybe even a little unwise to let that genie back
out of its bottle, however, we can and should probably do a better job
of warning people of this change in behavior in our documentation. Do
just this.

Change-Id: If7245a90711bd2ea13095ba26b9bc82ea3e17202
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1741810
"}]
commit_message:
docs: Improve 'AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation' docs

When we introduced the 'ImageMetaProps' o.vo in Liberty, we lost the
ability to consume arbitrary metadata configured for images. This
affects users of the 'AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation' filter, who may
have set such arbitrary metadata and expected their instances to be
restricted to host aggregates matching that metadata.

The world has changed a lot since Liberty was released, and it's
probably too late and maybe even a little unwise to let that genie back
out of its bottle, however, we can and should probably do a better job
of warning people of this change in behavior in our documentation. Do
just this.

Change-Id: If7245a90711bd2ea13095ba26b9bc82ea3e17202
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1741810

commit_message:
functional: Add and use 'GlanceFixture'

This rather beefy (but also quite simple) patch replaces the
'stub_out_image_service' call and associated cleanup in all functional
tests with a new 'GlanceFixture', based on the old 'FakeImageService'.
The use of a fixture means we don't have to worry about teardown and
allows us to stub Glance in the same manners as Cinder, Neutron,
Placement etc.

Unit test cleanup is handled in a later patch.

Change-Id: I6daea47988181dfa6dde3d9c42004c0ecf6ae87a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

In bug 1879787, the call to network_api.get_instance_nw_info() in
_post_live_migration() on the source compute manager eventually calls
out to the Neutron REST API. If this fails, the exception is
unhandled, and the migrating instance - which is fully running on the
destination at this point - will never be updated in the database.
This update normally happens later in
post_live_migration_at_destination().

The network_info variable obtained from get_instance_nw_info() is used
for two things: notifications - which aren't critical - and unplugging
the instance's vifs on the source - which is very important!

It turns out that at the time of the get_instance_nw_info() call, the
network info in the instance info cache is still valid for unplugging
the source vifs. The port bindings on the destination are only
activated by the network_api.migrate_instance_start() [1] call that
happens shortly *after* the problematic get_instance_nw_info() call.
In other words, get_instance_nw_info() will always return the source
ports. Because of that, we can replace it with a call to
instance.get_network_info().

NOTE(artom) The functional test has been excised, as in stable/train
the NeutronFixture does not properly support live migration with
ports, making the test worthless. The work to support this was done as
part of bp/support-move-ops-with-qos-ports-ussuri, and starts at
commit b2734b5a9ae8b869fc9e8e229826343da3b47fcb.

NOTE(artom) The
test_post_live_migration_no_shared_storage_working_correctly and

as part of the backport to pass with the new code.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/d9e04c4ff0b1a9c3383f1848dc846e93030d83cb/nova/network/neutronv2/api.py#L2493-L2522

commit_message:
post live migration: don't call Neutron needlessly

In bug 1879787, the call to network_api.get_instance_nw_info() in
_post_live_migration() on the source compute manager eventually calls
out to the Neutron REST API. If this fails, the exception is
unhandled, and the migrating instance - which is fully running on the
destination at this point - will never be updated in the database.
This update normally happens later in
post_live_migration_at_destination().

The network_info variable obtained from get_instance_nw_info() is used
for two things: notifications - which aren't critical - and unplugging
the instance's vifs on the source - which is very important!

It turns out that at the time of the get_instance_nw_info() call, the
network info in the instance info cache is still valid for unplugging
the source vifs. The port bindings on the destination are only
activated by the network_api.migrate_instance_start() [1] call that
happens shortly *after* the problematic get_instance_nw_info() call.
In other words, get_instance_nw_info() will always return the source
ports. Because of that, we can replace it with a call to
instance.get_network_info().

NOTE(artom) The functional test has been excised, as in stable/train
the NeutronFixture does not properly support live migration with
ports, making the test worthless. The work to support this was done as
part of bp/support-move-ops-with-qos-ports-ussuri, and starts at
commit b2734b5a9ae8b869fc9e8e229826343da3b47fcb.

NOTE(artom) The
test_post_live_migration_no_shared_storage_working_correctly and
test_post_live_migration_cinder_v3_api unit tests had to be adjusted
as part of the backport to pass with the new code.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/d9e04c4ff0b1a9c3383f1848dc846e93030d83cb/nova/network/neutronv2/api.py#L2493-L2522

Change-Id: If0fbae33ce2af198188c91638afef939256c2556
Closes-bug: 1879787
(cherry picked from commit 6488a5dfb293831a448596e2084f484dd0bfa916)
(cherry picked from commit 2c949cb3eea9cd9282060da12d32771582953aa2)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Failover group vol update fix

Replicated volumes that were in groups during failover
do not have their model_updates saved upon return to
manager.py as the replicated_vols list that is used to
determine which volume should be updated is changes during
_populate_volume_and_group_update_lists.

Change-Id: I03efee569c7f7efec20a04755d6e7c7a60bf61ea
Closes-Bug: 1888831

[{'created': '2019-09-20 21:10:43.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Sanity check instance mapping in _bury_in_cell0

mnaser reported a weird case where an instance was found
in both cell0 (deleted there) and in cell1 (not deleted
there but in error state from a failed build). It's unclear
how this could happen besides some weird clustered rabbitmq
issue where maybe the schedule and build request to conductor
happens twice for the same instance and one picks a host and
tries to build and the other fails during scheduling and is
buried in cell0.

To avoid a split brain situation like this, we add a sanity
check in _bury_in_cell0 to make sure the instance mapping is
not pointing at a cell when we go to update it to cell0.

Worst case is this is unnecessary but doesn't hurt anything,
best case is this helps avoid split brain clustered rabbit
issues.

Change-Id: I335113f0ec59516cb337d34b6fc9078ea202130f

commit_message:
Sanity check instance mapping during scheduling

mnaser reported a weird case where an instance was found
in both cell0 (deleted there) and in cell1 (not deleted
there but in error state from a failed build). It's unclear
how this could happen besides some weird clustered rabbitmq
issue where maybe the schedule and build request to conductor
happens twice for the same instance and one picks a host and
tries to build and the other fails during scheduling and is
buried in cell0.

To avoid a split brain situation like this, we add a sanity
check in _bury_in_cell0 to make sure the instance mapping is
not pointing at a cell when we go to update it to cell0.
Similarly a check is added in the schedule_and_build_instances
flow (the code is moved to a private method to make it easier
to test).

Worst case is this is unnecessary but doesn't hurt anything,
best case is this helps avoid split brain clustered rabbit
issues.

Change-Id: I335113f0ec59516cb337d34b6fc9078ea202130f

commit_message:
Refactor error messages.

When we didn't pass the redirect parameter in exceptions.handle() then
'_alert_message.html' template is used to displays the error messages.
If details are empty in a case but it still shows the 'Details' href
which is wrong and this patch adds a condition in that template to fix
that issue.

This patch also fix review comment of change-id
5081359295e5311ca725e80efa0bc4b2ec811a0e and define a constant for
'\u2026' and use it in all files.

Note: '\u2026' is used for unicode glyph representing '...'.

Closes-Bug: #1893305

Partially-Implements blueprint refactor-error-messages

Change-Id: If4409a1245c983fb51712c6c817c11e884916694
Co-Author: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>

the legacy policy - not the updated, scoped policy - since the legacy
policy is the default one currently.

change to use the same project ID as the 'OSAPIFixture'.

Enable the policy fixture by default, which should yield more realistic
functional tests. We need to update some tests to use admin APIs where
policy dictates they are necessary. Note that we're currently testing
the legacy policy - not the updated, scoped policy - since the legacy
policy is the default one currently.

commit_message:
functional: Enable real policy fixture by default

Enable the policy fixture by default, which should yield more realistic
functional tests. We need to update some tests to use admin APIs where
policy dictates they are necessary. Note that we're currently testing
the legacy policy - not the updated, scoped policy - since the legacy
policy is the default one currently.

Note that we also need to modify the 'SingleCellSimple' fixture in this
change to use the same project ID as the 'OSAPIFixture'.

Change-Id: Ia3dea78f16cb3c7081714c4db36e20d5ee76ed7d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix ignored test cases for nova::compute::libvirt

This patch fixes unit test cases for nova::copute::libvirt, which were
completely ignored during test cases.
This path also fixes some broken test cases and minor behavior of the
manifest file about "undef".

Change-Id: If5155db8635ad73ea1900a0143367802b9b159e8
Closes-Bug: #1895171
