(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2020-08-13 12:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

I think there is one massive responsibility missing from this new model, Stable Maintenance. Being probably the most important part of job claiming that we do production quality software, with all the extended stable branches being a thing and yet the new leadership model has no-one named responsible.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-08-13 13:40:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

@Erno: I think stable maint is covered. In this model, responsibility for backporting patches is distributed (same as in the PTL model), while responsibility of making stable releases is on the release liaison.

What do you think is missing?'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-08-13 14:08:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-08-13 14:46:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> @Erno: I think stable maint is covered. In this model,
 > responsibility for backporting patches is distributed (same as in
 > the PTL model), while responsibility of making stable releases is
 > on the release liaison.
 > 
 > What do you think is missing?

Making can be done by anyone, but reviewing sure is by the release liaison :)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-08-13 14:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-08-13 18:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-08-14 06:48:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-08-14 09:11:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> I think there is one massive responsibility missing from this new
 > model, Stable Maintenance. Being probably the most important part
 > of job claiming that we do production quality software, with all
 > the extended stable branches being a thing and yet the new
 > leadership model has no-one named responsible.

I'm not sure if that should really be here as it's not always PTL responsibility to maintain stable branches. I remember when I become Neutron's PTL I wasn't core in stable branches and there were opinions there that being PTL doesn't means directly that such person should have +2 power in stable branches. There is stable maintenance team which should be responsible for that. But that's only my opinion and I'm also ok with including such role here if others wants it :)"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-08-14 09:13:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2020-08-17 18:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Rollcall-Vote+1

I agree with the latest updates.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-08-17 23:26:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(2 comments)

I support this in principle since it seeks to create collective project ownership and reduce burnout; I've left a couple of questions inline."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-08-18 09:31:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2033, 'date': '2020-08-18 09:37:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Rollcall-Vote+1

I'm OK with the current state of the document. The point is a distributed leadership within the project team and not tag responsibilities to specific individuals."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-08-18 09:59:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-08-18 09:59:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> I'm OK with the current state of the document. The point is a
 > distributed leadership within the project team and not tag
 > responsibilities to specific individuals.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-08-18 10:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-08-18 17:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Rollcall-Vote-1

Only one concern I have is not having a single point of contact for TC (TC liaison) which I feel is must. Otherwise lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-09-01 15:51:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2020-09-01 21:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Rollcall-Vote+1

I think this looks good how it is. Well thought through. I am not concerned about requiring a TC liaison as, like Nate said, it will likely become the catch-all and, in the end, basically a PTL.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-09-03 14:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-09-03 15:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> I think this looks good how it is. Well thought through. I am not
 > concerned about requiring a TC liaison as, like Nate said, it will
 > likely become the catch-all and, in the end, basically a PTL.

I do not think TC liaison can end up like PTL, I think that will be very lightweight liaison compare to any other mandatory liaisons. I mean a very less frequent tasks to do when TC want which is very rare like project is not active or doing something very different than our guidelines ...'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-09-04 14:46:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Re: TC liaison: I think there is substantially more risk that a TC liaison would be assumed to be the default point of contact for everything, than a risk that the TC would not be able to contact anyone in that team and get the answers it needs.

So my preference is to merge as-is. We should not hold that review on that addition -- we can discuss the merits of adding a TC liaison to the mix in a separate review.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-09-04 15:06:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Rollcall-Vote+1

> Re: TC liaison: I think there is substantially more risk that a TC
 > liaison would be assumed to be the default point of contact for
 > everything, than a risk that the TC would not be able to contact
 > anyone in that team and get the answers it needs.
 > 
 > So my preference is to merge as-is. We should not hold that review
 > on that addition -- we can discuss the merits of adding a TC
 > liaison to the mix in a separate review.

Ok I agree with the plan to discuss the TC liaison in a separate review. I am ok to merge this.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-09-14 14:22:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-09-14 15:41:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-09-14 16:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-09-15 07:17:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-09-15 17:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Rollcall-Vote+1 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Resolution to define distributed leadership for projects

Some projects have expressed an interest to function without a PTL.
This resolution defines how a project would work with the
responsibilities of the PTL role separated into liaison roles instead of
held by a single individual.

Change-Id: I183f616e66d13066cd91e2659e1e90f5d2798d69
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

subject: Add option to check extra vhosts with nrpe

Code looks okay, but due to test coverage gap (see bug#1744257), evidence in the form of a test run is needed to demonstrate that the code works.'}, {'account_id': 21728, 'date': '2018-01-19 09:48:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-01-19 22:37:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Xav,

So, I guess I need to understand what this gains us. The charm already creates a new vhost, sets up permissions and checks said vhost. What do we gain by creating *more* vhosts and checking them? I might understand if these were externally created vhosts one wanted to check. But these are just fabricated.

If you have a compelling reason for this, then I would still request we remove the duplicate code. Make the list of vhosts at least contain the original "'nagios-%s' % current_unit" and have one version of the same block of code that creates, sets permissions and defines the check.

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 10086, 'date': '2018-02-14 01:52:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Regards the dup code, I'll work on that and resubmit.

The need for this is due to a situation whereby we have noted several times a particular existing vhost crashes in the cluster and the checks don't tell us about it.  This change is to allow us to specify a vhost that might already exist (in our case, 'openstack'), and get it checked.  The code to create the vhost is there simply to avoid errors if the vhost hasn't been externally created yet, but in most cases it'll do nothing."}, {'account_id': 10086, 'date': '2018-03-07 01:10:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10086, 'date': '2018-03-07 06:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

commit_message:
Add option to check extra vhosts with nrpe

Adds monitoring options to allow us to check for vhosts in addition to
the host specific one made by default, when using the nrpe subordinate.

Change-Id: I10715e8ab8c83fdd7d5c08736ee89472acfe3933
Related-Bug: 1730507

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I2f9d4c9a760bd9a9dbb9cde5bcb8af24fd4b34b9

hm.. I wonder if I'm missing something here, but w/out this change the docs job in stable/train will just not work. Will ask other folks to try and see if I'm doing something wrong. Thanks, Akihiro."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-09-14 16:44:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

the doc jobs runs ok for me, but i do have librsvg2-bin installed on my local system'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-09-14 19:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

 > on my local system

This is for Zuul CI to work. Look at build failure on patchset 1 to see how the docs job will fail w/out the binder.txt file'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-09-14 19:03:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> From the point of view of the CI job configuration, this commit is
 > unnecessary (roles/prepare-build-pdf-docs/tasks/main.yaml in
 > openstack-zuul-jobs handles the dependencies).
 > If this is for local build, I am okay with it.

Heh, I'm having a hard time locating roles/prepare-build-pdf-docs/tasks/main.yaml in openstack-zuul-jobs handles.
Can you send me a link? 

Also, if you look at the build failure on patchset 1 of this Gerrit you can see how bindep.txt is needed here.

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-09-15 06:31:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Heh, I'm having a hard time locating roles/prepare-build-pdf-docs/tasks/main.yaml in openstack-zuul-jobs handles.
> Can you send me a link?

You can find the role at https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/prepare-build-pdf-docs/tasks/main.yaml

I checked what is different from the master branch of neutron.

In case of neutron master, we can see opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/playbooks/tox-docs/pre.yaml as one of the pre playbooks. For example, https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/de158e2734c84da3b89fefafe8d007bd/console
On the other hand, in this case I don't see it as one of the pre playbooks and tox-docs job from base-jobs ( https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/zuul.d/python-jobs.yaml#L117 )

Hmm.... what does this difference come from???"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-09-15 06:36:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I am not sure what the difference come from, but according to the docs job result, some change is required.

At the moment, the docs job for train does not trigger PDF build, so another workaround is to drop 'sphinxcontrib.rsvgconverter' from 'extensions' configuration in doc/source/conf.py. (This is only required for the PDF build.)

Thought?"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-09-15 06:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Looking at https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/zuul.d/jobs.yaml#L584-L642, openstack-tox-docs job for train branch does not trigger PDF build. This triggers HTML build failure due to missing rsvg-converter. [{'created': '2020-08-28 18:02:17.000000000', 'message': 'Retire the devstack-plugin-zmq project

This plugin was used by the oslo.messaging project to test the
development of a message driver based on the ZeroMQ library.

commit_message:
Retire the devstack-plugin-zmq project

This plugin was used by the oslo.messaging project to test the
development of a message driver based on the ZeroMQ library.

The jobs using this plugin were non-voting and non-gating.

Development of this driver was dropped in Rocky and is not
supported.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/748724
Change-Id: I7c7ee35175c66e3f58860aa959775a0a8f78b481

commit_message:
Add exception for Sept 2020 term election

We are late by 3 week for PTL and 4 week for TC
election this time, Let's record this exception
and also agreement in TC.

I will add another review to link this exception
doc to TC charter speed up this exception let's
vote on this first as chrater change need more votes.

Change-Id: I4731e9bbd082824e72e307cc5c0d59e9ba93d439

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-05 17:30:35.000000000', 'message': "Don't age swap files in the image cache

Bug 1804262 revealed that the bdm query executed by the image cache
periodic task in _list_running_instances can be prohibitively
expensive on large deployments using shared storage. The only purpose
of this query is to populate used_swap_images, which is in turn used
by the libvirt driver's image cache to age the backing files of swap
disks.

This change removes this query, and the aging of swap disks.

In justification, firstly note that there is no good reason to store
swap disk backing files in the image cache. The motivation appears to
be to avoid running mkswap for each instance provisioned with a swap
disk, but mkswap is both very fast and uses very little disk space:

  $ truncate -s 256G swap.img

  $ time mkswap swap.img
  mkswap: swap.img: insecure permissions 0664, 0600 suggested.
  Setting up swapspace version 1, size = 256 GiB (274877902848 bytes)
  no label, UUID=7264593e-33aa-4e15-8bf3-65e65ee3504c

  real    0m0.006s
  user    0m0.001s
  sys     0m0.002s

  $ du -sh swap.img
  4.0K    swap.img

The other problem with having backing files for swap disks is that
they are generated locally to each compute host, but are not
identical:

  $ for i in 1 2; do truncate -s 1G swap$i.img; mkswap swap$i.img; done
  mkswap: swap1.img: insecure permissions 0664, 0600 suggested.
  Setting up swapspace version 1, size = 1024 MiB (1073737728 bytes)
  no label, UUID=98d0d2f0-8f84-4eb8-b3ab-c15deda1dd04
  mkswap: swap2.img: insecure permissions 0664, 0600 suggested.
  Setting up swapspace version 1, size = 1024 MiB (1073737728 bytes)
  no label, UUID=f7eddffa-9f44-4bbf-87bf-abdb2bb3d2c8

  $ md5sum swap?.img
  178b3b5e38c37d6b4474b013be001475  swap1.img
  6cd14d0bcfb5fae6c924e13fcbf58ae6  swap2.img

The problem with this is that if we migrate (cold or live) an
instance, we will use the same overlay file for the swap disk with the
host-local, and therefore different, backing file. In practise the
chances of this resulting in data corruption are low, but it is not a
good idea, and we shouldn't do it.

TL;DR The best solution here is to stop storing swap files in the
image cache, and provision a new one every time. That unfortunately
requires invasive changes to the libvirt driver.

Secondly, note that swap disk backing files are provisioned based on
size. Unlike glance images, which is the primary purpose of the image
cache, the number of different swap sizes in use across a deployment
is unlikely to grow significantly over time, so the cost of not aging
them is low.

Lastly, note that although we age backing files for swap disks, we
don't age them for ephemeral disks. For the same reasons as swap
disks, we should also not store backing files for ephemeral disks in
the image cache.

Closes-Bug: #1804262
Related-Bug: #1253991
Change-Id: I7a62930425ec3ebac4120ac60b5d548458ead2ed

commit_message:
libvirt: Don't age swap files in the image cache

Bug 1804262 revealed that the bdm query executed by the image cache
periodic task in _list_running_instances can be prohibitively
expensive on large deployments using shared storage. The only purpose
of this query is to populate used_swap_images, which is in turn used
by the libvirt driver's image cache to age the backing files of swap
disks.

This change removes this query, and the aging of swap disks.

In justification, firstly note that there is no good reason to store
swap disk backing files in the image cache. The motivation appears to
be to avoid running mkswap for each instance provisioned with a swap
disk, but mkswap is both very fast and uses very little disk space:

  $ truncate -s 256G swap.img

  $ time mkswap swap.img
  mkswap: swap.img: insecure permissions 0664, 0600 suggested.
  Setting up swapspace version 1, size = 256 GiB (274877902848 bytes)
  no label, UUID=7264593e-33aa-4e15-8bf3-65e65ee3504c

  real    0m0.006s
  user    0m0.001s
  sys     0m0.002s

  $ du -sh swap.img
  4.0K    swap.img

The other problem with having backing files for swap disks is that
they are generated locally to each compute host, but are not
identical:

  $ for i in 1 2; do truncate -s 1G swap$i.img; mkswap swap$i.img; done
  mkswap: swap1.img: insecure permissions 0664, 0600 suggested.
  Setting up swapspace version 1, size = 1024 MiB (1073737728 bytes)
  no label, UUID=98d0d2f0-8f84-4eb8-b3ab-c15deda1dd04
  mkswap: swap2.img: insecure permissions 0664, 0600 suggested.
  Setting up swapspace version 1, size = 1024 MiB (1073737728 bytes)
  no label, UUID=f7eddffa-9f44-4bbf-87bf-abdb2bb3d2c8

  $ md5sum swap?.img
  178b3b5e38c37d6b4474b013be001475  swap1.img
  6cd14d0bcfb5fae6c924e13fcbf58ae6  swap2.img

The problem with this is that if we migrate (cold or live) an
instance, we will use the same overlay file for the swap disk with the
host-local, and therefore different, backing file. In practise the
chances of this resulting in data corruption are low, but it is not a
good idea, and we shouldn't do it.

TL;DR The best solution here is to stop storing swap files in the
image cache, and provision a new one every time. That unfortunately
requires invasive changes to the libvirt driver.

Secondly, note that swap disk backing files are provisioned based on
size. Unlike glance images, which is the primary purpose of the image
cache, the number of different swap sizes in use across a deployment
is unlikely to grow significantly over time, so the cost of not aging
them is low.

Lastly, note that although we age backing files for swap disks, we
don't age them for ephemeral disks. For the same reasons as swap
disks, we should also not store backing files for ephemeral disks in
the image cache.

Closes-Bug: #1804262
Related-Bug: #1253991
Change-Id: I7a62930425ec3ebac4120ac60b5d548458ead2ed

commit_message:
Remove the obsolete --block-migrate parameter

Since Mitaka, nova is able to figure out whether to use
block migration or not all on its own, so we no longer
need to check the storage back-end and react to it.

Change-Id: I5282159ff109a1cccc42426b42869cea5d450a0a
(cherry picked from commit 859d9c05d8c39f6cdadf3eac363aa98fb8f8f208)
